segments.text: Hi Benjamin . My name is Dr . Green . What seems to be the matter ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've been feeling pretty ill for a few days now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I feel chilly , I've got cramps , I keep throwing up , and I feel dizzy and tired .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it sounds like you might be a bit dehydrated . Do you feel thirsty most of the day ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes . I can't seem to drink enough .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: have you been drinking plenty of water ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok . Well , we'll have a nurse take some blood in a few minutes to see if you're dehydrated . First , let me feel your pulse .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that seems to be a bit low , but that's not uncommon when you're ill .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: is anyone else sick in your home ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , but my girlfriend has mono .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . I'll have the lab techs run some tests to check for mono as well then . The burse will come in then to take your blood , we'll run some tests , and then you can go home . You should hear from us
segments.speaker: S1
